Taiwan: Zhu Yigui and a group of 80 rebels attack a military outpost at Gangshan, south of Tainan, and rob its weapons; Du Junying also rebels
Zhu Yigui's rebels attack Tainan but fail
Zhu Yigui takes Tainan and Zhuluo
Zhu Yigui is declared a king
Qing forces land near Tainan and defeat Zhu Yigui
Du Junying surrenders to Qing forces
Sweden: The Treaty of Nystad is signed, requiring Sweden to cede Estonia, Livonia and Ingria to Russia.
Russia: Peter established the Holy Synod, a body of ten clergymen chaired by a secular official, that was to head the Russian Orthodox Church in lieu of the Patriarch of Moscow.
Great Northern War: The Treaty of Nystad ended the war. Sweden ceded Estonia, Livonia and Ingria to Russia.
Philippine: Toribio José Cosio y Campo appointed Governor-General (1721–1729).
Latvia: Great Northern War: The Treaty of Nystadt ended the war.
Estonia: Estonia was formally ceded by Sweden to Russia by the Treaty of Nystad.
China: Chinese Rites controversy: The Kangxi Emperor banned Christian missions in China.
